Kup

"We are waitting for you, old friend "said Kup"Kup out"

Elita Huged K=
up sensing that something was wrong.


From: Sandy 
Sent: Sunday, March 07,=
 2010 9:59 PM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: Back to the Ark


  =

Tucson continues his journey with Lord Elder. He wished he still had his o=
ptical sensors working because a drive through wilderness wasn't a drive un=
less you could fully take in the scenery. But now was not the time for wish=
ful thinking. 

" That's why I wanted to wait until I arrive at the Ark Kup=
. I'd like you and Elita to be there when I tell you the news. Tell Elita t=
hat I won't let her down. No matter what happens, she's got me on her side =
too. She'll remember me, old slow poke." 

Upon hearing Elita in the backgr=
ound, Tucson's heart sinks as he bares to think what he has to tell her. Fo=
r a moment he goes silent. 

" My - estimated time of arrival will be two h=
ours and thirty minutes Kup. I'll talk to you all when I get there. Elita, =
if you can hear me, old Slow Poke says hi and he'll see you real soon."

He=
 breaks the contact just before his voice breaks somewhat. It was hard to t=
ell that he was feeling a great sadness in his vehicle mode, yet it was the=
re.

" Primus, how on Cybertron am I going to tell her the news when I know=
 how sensitive Elita can be? Lord Elder, if anything could hurt me a great =
deal, it's giving a child the terrible news that both her parents were abdu=
cted by Predacons and Decepticons and turned against their factions. Slag i=
t! Why didn't I succeede the first time?! Now I have to go back there and t=
ell them I failed in bringing Rodimus and Nightlight back to them. It hurts=
 Lord Elder, it really, really hurts." 

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, <ai=
rly2002@...> wrote:
>
> Kup:
> 
> "choose your words wisely, my friend" sai=
d Kup by comlink "Elita is watting news for her parets and..."
> 
> "uncle =
Kup????"said a tiny background vioce "who is it, Uncle? is lord Elder? Does=
 he have news from my dad and mon?"
> 
> "Yes, little one... We have some n=
ews, and we will know it till my old friend Tucson and Lord Elder came back=
 " replied Kup and now talking to Tucson and Lord Elder "We are waitting yo=
u"
> 
> 
> 
> From: Sandy 
> Sent: Saturday, March 06, 2010 10:02 PM
> To: =
nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
> Subject: Re: Back to the Ark
> 
> 
> 
> Tucson st=
arts up his engine and rolls off slowly from the ramp of the shuttle, with =
Lord Elder inside his cab. He wasn't much for burning rubber needlessly, an=
d always took caution instead of wrecklesness when it came to his driving h=
abits. Right down to signalling a right turn when it came time to turn righ=
t, and keeping his speed at a reasonable clip. When he feels the ground ben=
eath his tires become rough, he shifts into manual gear to activate his all=
 wheel drive system, and is careful to take it easy through rocky river bed=
s. Water splashes up over his cab, as does mud. But it doesn't bother him i=
n the least.
> 
> " I wish I could say enjoy the ride, maybe one of these d=
ays I can. According to my transmitter, we're quite a bit a way from the Ar=
k.. Estimated arrival time says about three hours... I wish I could get the=
re sooner but if I go too fast, I'll kick up dust, and that's a dead giveaw=
ay. This way, if I stick to moist ground for most of the journey, and if I =
can help it, through grassy plains, I may be able to avoid being seen. So f=
ar I think sticking to water ways is best. No dust, no prints, no scent, no=
 can track."
> 
> He continues to buffer his and Lord Elder's signatures so=
 is to appear that they are not even enroute to the Ark. While he travels, =
he taps into the Ark's com link.
> 
> " Kup, I'm sorry I didn't answer your=
 question earlier, I'd rather tell you in person to not risk any informatio=
n getting in the wrong hands. The less info we put out in the open the bett=
er. "
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston Carroll <supercyclonus@> =
wrote:
> >
> > > "Gazoontite. Anyway, you can count on us Lord Elder. We pr=
omise, we'll watch our backs every step of the way."
> > >
> > > Quickstrid=
e shakes his head after sneezing.
> > >
> > > " We won't do anything you wo=
uldn't do, Sir. We'll have to move fast though, Lord Perseus probably needs=
 us ASAP."
> > >
> > > Rat Trap opens the hatch door while on Quickstride's=
 back.
> > >
> > > "Wish us luck guys. We're gonna need it."
> > 
> > Elder=
 nodded and smiled at Rat Trap and Quickstride. "I wish you
> > success, ma=
y Primus help both of you." he said as he watched them
> > leave. "May he w=
atch over all of us." he said under his breath as he
> > turned back to Tus=
con."
> > 
> > > " I think we should leave the shuttle where it is and head=
 toward the Ark on wheels. We can cover more ground that way. Plus, it's be=
en a while since I've done any form of off road driving and if we keep off =
the main roadways, no one will ever suspect that we've gone back to the Ark=
 instead of taking the bait."
> > >
> > 
> > 
> > Elder looked at the shutt=
le thoughtfully, resting a hand on it. "Hmmm"
> > he said finally, "That mi=
ght not be a bad idea." He depressed a few
> > controls, trying to lock it =
down. Of course no lock is perfect.
> > 
> > He looked back at Tuscon, who =
had transformed into his vehicular mode already.
> > 
> > > He transforms i=
nto his SUV mode and opens his door to Lord Elder.
> > >
> > > "So who want=
s shotgun?"
> > 
> > With one last look back at the shuttle Elder slid into=
 the proffered
> > door that Tuscon held open. "Let's go. We have a lot of =
things ahead
> > of us."
> > 
> > OOC: Don't forget, this is millions of ye=
ars into Earth's past. Not
> > only are there no roads, but everything is c=
ompletely wild, and you
> > get to contend with things like Dinosaurs along=
 the way! :)
> > 
> > Preston
> >
>
